definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
bare upper body/bare-chested/to bare one's chest
to throw off inhibitions/to go all out

sentences.english: You feel you can't walk around naked in your own flat.
sentences.chinese: 你發覺即便是在自家房子裏也不能光着膀子走。

sentences.english: Why is it acceptable for Chinese men to walk around in the summer with their shirts pulled up to their nipples.
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼中國男人們在夏天可以光膀子走在大街上？

sentences.english: "Oh, " she exclaimed, clasping her hands and stretching her arms out toward him.
sentences.chinese: “啊，”她喊着，捏緊她的手，向他伸出兩條膀子來。

sentences.english: Don't ask me why, but I've become fascinated with men's arms.
sentences.chinese: 別問我爲什麼，反正我已經對男人的膀子着迷起來了。

sentences.english: He courted the summer girls on boarding-house porches.
sentences.chinese: 他在公寓涼臺上跟夏天來度假的青年女客吊膀子。

sentences.english: No. Would you consider not wearing a shirt with your coat and tie?
sentences.chinese: 我當然不會光着膀子穿西裝打領帶了。

sentences.english: George put a kindly arm around my shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 喬治伸出膀子，親親熱熱地摟住我的肩膀。

definition: bare upper body/bare-chested/to bare one's chest
calf (back of the leg below the knee)
to grimace (in pain)/to show one's teeth/to bare one's fangs
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
